loans.name: Hieat's Group

texts.en: Hieat is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district, which is located in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has four dependent children, all of whom are in school. To support her family, she plants cassava on a one-hectare farm and takes various jobs where she works for a salary. Each day, she is able to earn approximately 19,000 KHR and manages to save around 12,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. She has already taken out and repaid previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and has made good use of the money to improve her family's living standards. She is requesting a new loan to buy gasoline and to cover the cost of hiring people to work on her farm. She leads a four-person loan group whose members are requesting a loan for 4,100,000 KHR. Hieat strongly believes that she can use her portion of this loan, which is for 1,000,000 KHR, to provide her family with a better life. She will use the profits she expects to earn to bring her dream house to life and buy a new motorbike to make the transportation from her home to her rice field easier.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on a farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en: Leang is 51 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province in the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, She is married and the mother of six children, three of whom are still dependent on her. To offer a decent life to her family, Leang has been growing rice and cassava for more than 20 years. She has also earned extra money on the side by working at various jobs. She leads a two-person loan group whose members are applying for their fourth loans from VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Each member of this group is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR. Leang will use her portion of this loan to hire people to work on her farm and pay for transportation costs. Her goal for the future is to buy more farmland so that she can increase her productivity as well as profits.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on a farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Socheat's Group

texts.en: Socheat, a mother of one schoolboy, is a citizen from the Kandal district of Kandal Province. She grows rice in order to support her family, while her husband works at construction site. She has five years’ experience in this business and is able to earn about KHR 23,600 per day. Socheat's group consists of three members: two, including her, are second-time borrowers, and a remaining member in the group is a fourth-time borrower. She was very satisfied indeed with her first loan, which she has completely paid back, as it helped her relieve her family's burden better than before. Now, she is the leader of her group. She will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the transplanting fee for her rice farm. She hopes to gain a better yield and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the transplanting fee.

loans.name: Som Orn's Group

texts.en:
Som Orn, age 33, is a citizen residing in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district located in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three kids, all of whom are dependent on her. Only two are currently in school, while the other one is too young to attend school. Som Orn makes her living by farming rice and raising pigs. To earn extra income for the family, she also works for others as a paid worker. Each day she is able to earn around 21,000 KHR and save approximately 11,000 KHR, after offsetting her daily living expenses. 

Som Orn is leading a group of three female members, to take out a loan in the amount of 2,900,000 KHR in total. Som Orn, the group's leader, and one of her fellow group members, have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles already. The other group member has been with VisionFund for just one loan cycle. Som Orn will use her portion of the new loan to support her business, by purchasing fertilizer and pig feeds. She would like to be able to build a warm, comfortable house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pig feeds, to enhance the productivity of her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vanoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Vanoeurn, 33, is a mother of one son. For her, rice farming is her main source of family income. She has engaged in this business for 18 years. This current business has enabled her to earn about 33,900 KHR per day and saves her about 11,500 KHR per day. 

In a group of five members, she is the leader. She and one of her co-borrowers are third-time borrowers, another two are fourth-time borrowers, and the remaining one is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Each member in the group is seeking the same loan amount: 600,000 KHR each. Vanoeurn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to earn more income from her high yield and maintain her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sodany's Group

texts.en: Sodany is a 41-year-old mother from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She strives to make a living through rice farming on one and half hectares of farmland. To make extra income, her husband catches fish for resale. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She has been in this business for ten years and is able to earn up to KHR 13,600 per day. This is the first loan for her group of two with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to support her husband’s business by buying fishing nets and fixing the fishing boat. She hopes her husband can make a larger income in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fix the fishing boat.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en: Phon, 45, is a villager living in Kampong Cham Province’s Prey Chhor district of Cambodia. She is married and has three children. Phon and her husband earn income for the family by working as rice farmers. Together, they earn approximately KHR 23,000 per day and save around KHR 8,500 after deducting the daily cost of living. This will be Phon’s third loan from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The help that she has already received in the form of past loans has been crucial for her to improve the living conditions of her family. Now she is leading a group of five women to apply for a new loan. Phon will spend her portion of the requested loan mainly on fertilizer and pesticide. This hard-working woman also wants to run a new business growing cabbages and cucumbers. She will spend a portion of her loan on buying cabbage and cucumber seeds. Her only hope in the future is to run her business smoothly so that she can boost her income and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rorng's Group

texts.en: Rorng is 56 years old and a rural villager from Pursat province's Kror Kor district. She has tackled the family's financial difficulty by growing rice and raising pigs. She is able to earn up to KHR 8,700 per day from the business, which she has had for twelve years. Since she is short of working capital for supporting her business, she has formed a group of two to apply for their first loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She, the group leader, is asking for KHR 400,000, and her co-member is applying for KHR 1,000,000. Rorng will use part of her loan to buy fertilizer for her crop husbandry and part of it to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to grow her rice and raise her pigs in healthy condition so she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pigs.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en: Lay, a 42-year-old married mother of four children, is a local farmer from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. Her main source of income is from three hectares of rice cultivation, which she has farmed for 30 years. It has provided her with KHR 24,500 per day in daily average income. Three loan cycles ago, she took out her original loan, which she has completely paid back already. She used this loan wisely to improve her business. Now, she leads a group of three to request a new loan. The total loan amount for the entire group is KHR 2,600,000. Lay will use her portion, KHR 1,200,000, to buy fertilizer and plow her farmland. She hopes to double her yield so she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plow her farmland.

loans.name: Vansoeung's Group

texts.en: Vansoeung, a permanent resident from Pursat province's Kror Kor district, is 30 years old and a mother of two young children. On two hectare of farmland where her rice is growing, she is able to earn about 17,700 KHR per day. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Including this cycle, she is a third-time borrower from VisionFund. After the successful loan which she has paid back, she feels confident that she can upgrade her living conditions better than before. Now, she joins a group of three as a leader. With her loan portion, she is going to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to grow her rice soon and receive high output.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, a 45-year-old married mother of six, has been farming rice in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia for several years. Mom’s husband is a paid worker in a local area to earn additional income for the family. This current occupation earns them approximately 14,000KHR per day, and they manage to save about 5,000KHR daily after expenses.

Mom’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. Mom, in her first micro loan with VisionFund, and her group members are applying for a loan of 150,000KHR each. As the leader, Mom will use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine including a latrine bowl, tile draining, and sewage pipe. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a hygienic latrine so as to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy material for building a latrine.

loans.name: Suon's Group

texts.en:
Suon is a 30-year-old farmer from Pursat province's Kror Kor district. He is a local farmer who grows rice on two hectares of farmland in order to support his two children, who are still young. His wife also helps to generate more income through pig-raising. He has been involved in this business for four years and is able to earn about 21,900 KHR per day. 

Suon's group consists of two members; he is a second loan cycle client and his co-member is a first loan cycle client. The past loan has helped him to maintain his rice growing business, and eventually he will be able to buy a buffalo to support his farm. Now, he and his co-member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his rice. He hopes to receive a good output and sell at a high price so he can earn more income for his children's sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice

loans.name: Kosol

texts.en:
Kosol is a 27-year-old, married mother, who lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. All of her children are dependents and in school. To support a family, Kosol sells grocery items in her local area, and her husband is a rice farmer. They have been in these businesses for seven years, to make a living. Her family's daily income is approximately US$20, and they can manage to save about US$2.50 each day, after covering their daily living expenses. Scarcity of water supply is the main challenge for Kosol and her husband, in the rice farming business.
  
Kosol is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of US$700. She wants to use part of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and use part of it for buying more grocery items for resale. Kosol hopes her loan will improve her standard of living, as well help to increase her income from her current businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and inventory for her grocery selling business.

loans.name: Anogile Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her early 40's, is a widow with four children who go to school. For 2 years now, Mary has managed her family expenses by running a fish business. She works from 10 am to midnight daily and she is able to make a small monthly profit. 

She took several loans before from Tujijenge Tanzania, but stopped due to some health problems. Now, Mary requests a loan which she wants to use to increase business stock to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a food shop so as to raise her income. 

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "ANOGILE", which totals 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase business stock to resell.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon is 28 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and three daughters in a rural village within Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, in Cambodia. All of Pon's children are still in school.

Farming is her family's primary source of income. Besides farming, Pon also sells vegetables and meats within the local area around where she lives, to better support her family. Her daily income is approximately 46,000 KHR. After off-setting daily expenses, Pon manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day. Pon’s husband supplements the family`s income by fishing. They have been in these businesses for ten years 

Scarcity of working capital is the main challenge for her farming business. Pon has worked with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and has already fully paid back her past loan. She successfully and wisely utilized her previous loan to better support her family. Now, she is applying for another loan, for 4,000,000 KHR. Pon intends on using this loan`s proceeds to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her cultivated land. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and increase her income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her cultivated land

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, a 25-year-old married father of two children, both of whom are under school age, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, Sopheap has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland for four years. The current business earns him approximately 23,000 KHR per day, and he manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Sopheap has been with VisionFund for one loan already, while the other group member is requesting his first loan. Sopheap completely repaid the past loan which helped him to relieve his family’s financial burden. He will use his portion of this loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland as he hopes to increase his crop yield so as to make a better living and fulfill his dream of building a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Visak

texts.en:
Visak is a 31-year-old father of two schoolchildren from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. He fulfills the needs of his family by working as an electrician while his wife works as a cleaner in a private school. He has engaged in this business for ten years and is able to earn about six US dollars per day. 

This is his third time working with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. He has fully paid back his past loan and it has helped him to cover his children's education. For this portion, he is seeking 600 US dollars in order to buy necessary materials for his business such as diagonal cutters, knee-pads, a continuity tester, and electronic wiring tools. He hopes to purchase these items on time so as he can acquire more clients and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for his electrician business.

loans.name: Horacio Lucio

texts.es: Don Horacio habitante de la comarca Santa Rita en un acolonia, desde pequeño tiene la vocación del trabajo en el campo, actualmente es ganadero agricultor, tiene su finca propia apta para el desarrollo ganadero y agrícola, su principal rubro que desarrolla es el trabajo con vacas paridas, donde elabora queso de la producción de leche, obteniendo buenos beneficios, de esta manera satisface las necesidades de su finca y del núcleo familiar don Horacio solicita nuevamente apoyo de crédito para comprar 3 vacas paridas, el está agradecido con Afodenic y Kiva ya que por este medio ha salido adelante en su economía poco a poco con prestamos.
texts.en:
Don Horacio, who lives in a district of the Santa Rita region, has worked in the countryside since he was little. Now he is a livestock farmer. He has his own farm suitable for livestock and agricultural development. His main area of development is working with calved cows, to produce cheese and milk, acheiving good profits. This satisfies the needs of his farm and of his nuclear family. 

Don Horacio is asking again for credit support to buy 3 calved cows. He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva as in this way he has moved forward in his finances little by little, with loans.

loans.use: to buy 3 calved cows.

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en:
Non, a 38-year-old rural villager from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, has four children, two of whom are still in school. Her main source of income is rice growing, which she has been engaged in for 12 years, earning her about 9,700 KHR per day. In addition to helping on the farmland, her husband catches fish to sell.

In this group of six, Non is making her third loan request, while another member is on the fourth, with the remaining four taking out their first loan. Non has made good use of her previous loans, with the income arising from them providing sufficient decent food for her children as well as hygienic living conditions. She will use her loan portion to buy a fishing outfit to support her husband's business. She hopes that this fishing material will help her husband to catch more fish to sell and earn more extra income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing outfit to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is a villager from Kror Kor district of Pursat province, where rice farming is the common business for the villagers, including Sinat. She has three children in her care. The paddy, which has been growing on one and a half hectares of farmland, earns her about 12,300 KHR per day. She has engaged in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from a fishing business.

In this group of three, she is the leader. She and one of her fellow group members are in their second loan cycle. and the remaining one is in her fourth loan cycle. Sinat can afford decent food from a decent income, as the outcome of her past loan. Now, she will use her portion of the new loan to fix the fishing boat, and to buy fishing materials, for supporting her business. She hopes that she can maintain a good pace of her business and keep upgrading her lifestyle, gradually.

loans.use: To fix the fishing boat and to buy fishing material

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: El Joven Misael de 23 años de edad es soltero y sin hijos, desarrolla su actividad ganadera y agrícola en la comarca el Verdum siendo dueño de su parcela a la que le brinda un buen cuido especialmente a las vaquillas, las cuales tiene que darle buen manejo sanitario y nutricional, con el objetivo de garantizar una producción de calidad, es un excelente cliente con muchos deseos de salir adelante en su rubro ganadero, también está desarrollando actividades agrícolas en su finca, obteniendo buenas ganancias en sus cosechas y de las ventas de semovientes. Para seguir aumentando su productividad solicita su tercer crédito con Afodenic para comprar 4 vaquillas y así continuar brindándole apoyo a su familia que para él es muy importante.
texts.en: Misael, 23, is single and does not have children. He farms and raises livestock in the Verdum district, where he owns a parcel of land on which he tends heifers. He makes sure they are healthy and well fed because his goal is to guarantee a high quality product and to be a successful breeder. He also cultivates his land and produces both profitable harvests and good livestock sales. He is applying for his third loan with Afodenic so that he can increase his production by buying four heifers and, therefore, continue to support his family, which is very important to him.

loans.use: to buy four heifers.

loans.name: Jim

texts.es:
Jim es un hombre de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Jim no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Jim trabaja como Auxiliar de Almacén en una empresa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien su empeño y responsabilidad.
Jim se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realiza el mejoramiento de hogar, él desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y otros arreglos a su hogar; de esta manera Jim tendrá su vivienda mejores condiciones, con mayor seguridad, bienestar y comodidad, así pues Jim seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Jim is 27 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a desire to improve himself.  Unfortunately because of a lack of financial resources and a need to work to support his parents, Jim was not able to attend university to study Business Administration like he wanted.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.

Through his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Jim works as a store assistant at a business in his city.  Every day from early in the morning, he goes to the store to start his work.  He can work about eight hours and believes that it is going well because he works hard and is responsible.  

Jim is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the support they have provided, he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He wants to refinish the walls, paint them, and make other repairs to his home.  This will allow him to have better living conditions with better security for his well-being and comfort.  He will be able to continue working and making progress towards achieving his dreams and goals.

loans.use: to make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Orlandine

texts.es:
Orlandine es un hombre de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 6 añitos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Orlandine no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace más de un año Orlandine trabaja como carpintero, todos los días desde tempranas hora de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar una aproximado de 10 horas y hace trabajos de puertas, ventanas, mesas, sillas y otros, él cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y porque trata bien a sus clientes.
Orlandine se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de diversas herramientas, tales como una cierra, serruchos, martillos, clavos, lijas, entre otros; de esta manera Orlandine tendrá su taller de carpintería mejor acondicionado y podrá contar con las herramientas necesarias para realizar si labor, así pues Orlandin espera seguir trabajando para poder cumplir sus sueños de hacer a su pequeño hijo profesional y  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Orlandine is a 30-year-old man who lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district, with his wife and small 6-year-old son whom he loves and are his main motive in life.  He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, works as hard as he can to get his family ahead.  Unfortunately, Orlandine could not study to get a prefessional career because from a very young age he had to work to help his parents.

With much determination, dedication, and thanks to the support from his family, Orlandine has worked as a carpenter for more than a year. He works every day from the early hours of the morning when he begins his work.  He can work more than 10 hours, and does work on doors, windows, tables, chairs, and other things.  He believes it is going well because he is very responsible and because he treats his clients well.

Orlandine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to purchase various tools such as a power saw, hand saws, hammers, nails, and sandpaper, among others.  This way Orlandine will have his carpentry shop better equipped and he will be able to have all the necessary tools to carry out his work.  Therefore, Orlandine hopes to continue working to be able to fulfill his dreams of making his small son a professional and of having his own house.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as a power saw, hand saws, hammers, nails, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos Ana no pudo estudiar la carrera de Enfermería, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ella se siente muy comprometido con su familia, puesto que es la hija mayo y se preocupa mucho por sus 2 hermanos menores, a quienes ama y desea poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace más de un años Ana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor de búsqueda de alimento, limpieza y cuidado de sus cuyes, Ana se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que tiene hacia los demás.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de cuyes para su crianza y para luego cuando estos crezcan poder venderlos; de esta manera Ana espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus sueño de poder tener su granja de cuyes, donde pueda criar variedad de razas y así también espera poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que tanto desea.
texts.en:
Ana is a young 18-year-old woman who is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources Ana was not able to study for a nursing career because from a young age she had to work in order to help her parents with the household expenses.  She feels very committed to her family since she is the oldest daughter and worries a lot for her two younger siblings, whom she loves and wishes to be able to provide a good quality of life.  

With much determination and dedication, Ana has worked for more than a year in her small business of raising and selling guinea pigs.  She works every day from the early hours of the morning when she begins her work in search of food, cleanliness, and care for her guinea pigs.  Ana feels at ease with her work and believes that it is going well as a result of her dedication and the friendly way she treats others.

Ana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered her she will be able to purchase a greater quantity of guinea pigs to raise, and then later when they have grown she can sell them.  This way Ana hopes to continue working and pushing herself to achieve her dream of having her own guinea pig farm where she can raise a variety of breeds, and she also hopes to be able to study for the nursing career that she wishes to have.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables.

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Saveoun, 51 years old, is a villager in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district located in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is married and a mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and currently in school. To make a living, Saveoun and her husband are working as rice farmers and fishermen. Having been in this business for more than 30 years, together they are able to earn around 19,000 KHR per day. 

Saveoun is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and a representative of a group that consists of two female members. She is leading her group to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. With her requested loan portion, Saveoun will buy fertilizer and fishing materials (fish trap and cast net). 

In the future, she would like to see improvement in her current business as well as the profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old villager living in a rural area of Dambae district located in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia, Ren is married with three children, one (daughter) of whom is still under her responsibility. To support her family, Ren has a business planting cassava on one-hectare of farmland. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five loan cycles already. Ren is so satisfied that the lifestyle of her family has been improved gradually via the help of the previous loans that she obtained and successfully paid back. Now she is in need of money to support her business, which is the main source of the family’s income. Thus, she is leading a group of two female members to take out a loan in the amount of 300,000 KHR each. Ren will use her requested loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees. This industrious woman, Ren, would like to dedicate all of her hard work to moving her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Sert's Group

texts.en:
Sert, 37, is married with three children, and resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. All of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the family, Sert has been farming rice on seven hectares of farmland for ten years. Her husband plants beans on three hectares of farmland to gain more income and better support the family. Low crop yields resulting from flooding is the main challenge for her farming business. 

Sert has been with VisonFund for six cycles, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Sert completely paid back her previous loans from VisionFund and successfully used the money to better support her family. She and her fellow group member are applying for loans of KHR 1,400,000 and KHR 200,000 respectively. As the leader, Sert will use most of her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland, and devote a portion of it to purchasing gasoline. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ravy's Group

texts.en:
Ravy, 48 years old, is married and has three children. Her family lives in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district of the Battambang province in Cambodia. Out of her three children, Ravy still has one dependent child who is still in school. 

To earn a living, Ravi has been working as a teacher for twenty years while her husband is a rice farmer. She is able to earn about 53,000 KHR per day. After off-setting daily expenses, Ravi manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day. However, a lack of working capital to support her rice field, is still the main challenge Ravi faces.

Ravy’s Group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. Ravi fully paid back her previous loans, which helped her constantly support her family with the provision of food and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group to seek yet another loan. Ravy expects to use the proceeds from her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, as well as pay for labor costs to work the land. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the income from the rice field, better her living conditions and support her child who is still in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A villager residing in a rural area of Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia, Nan is a 37-year-old married woman with two dependent kids (one daughter and one son), both of whom are currently in school. Nan has fifteen years of experience in her current businesses, which are rice growing and pig raising. Each day, she is able to earn around 20,000 KHR and save approximately 10,000 KHR after offsetting her daily cost of living. 

Nan is leading a group of two female members who are both first-time borrowers with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer and more pigs to raise. She highly believes that this loan will have a positive impact on her current businesses as well as her family's living condition.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and more pigs to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khang's Group

texts.en:
Khang is 38 years old and resides in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three kids, all of whom are under her care. To provide a decent life for her family, Khang has been working as a rice farmer on a one-hectare plot of farmland for more than ten years, enabling her to earn around 19,000 KHR per day and save approximately 10,000 KHR for future needs after canceling out her daily cost of living. 

Khang's group consists of three female members. The group leader, Khang, and one of her fellow group members have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already, whereas the other has just joined VisionFund. Khang says that with the previous loan she was able to improve her livelihood and meet the family's needs, which made her feel so satisfied. Now she is in need of money to buy fertilizer to help keep her business in good shape. Thus, she is leading her group to take out a loan of 2,900,000 KHR in total. With the help of her loan portion of this loan, she hopes that her business will grow rapidly so that she can boost her income and be able to sufficiently support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
A citizen residing in Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia, Khun is 40 years of age and married. She has three children, including two daughters who are under her care and currently in school. She supports her family by working as a rice farmer, while her husband supplements the family income by working for others as a paid worker. Khun has eighteen years of experience in her rice-growing business, earning around 12,000 KHR daily and saving approximately 6,000 KHR after deducting her expenses. 

Khun is a first-time borrower, and is leading a group member who also is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) to apply for a loan of 600,000 KHR in total. As the group leader, Khun will utilize her portion of the loan (500,000 KHR) to buy fertilizer to apply to her farmland. She would be very satisfied to be able to obtain her requested loan. With the help of this money, she believes that her family's living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 33 years of age and resides in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three dependent kids (two daughters and one son), all of whom are school-aged children. Pheap and her husband plant cassava and farm rice to earn the living for the family. 

Pheap’s group consists of three female members, who all are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group representative, Pheap is leading her group to request a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. With her requested loan portion, she plans on utilizing it to cover the fees of labor. Pheap’s biggest hope in the future is, after receiving her loan portion and efficiently using it, to be able to harvest good quality crop yields so that she can sell them at good prices, generating more income for the family. She will use the anticipated income to fully support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: To cover labor fees

loans.name: Pet's Group

texts.en:
Pet, 31, is married with three children, and resides in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, in Cambodia. All of her children are dependents and still in school. For the last ten years, Pet has been farming rice as the primary source of her family’s income, and supplementing this by selling grocery items in the local area. The current businesses earn her about 14,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 9,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.  

Pet’s group consists of three members who live in the same village; Pet has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for another loan, Pet, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice in a timely and healthy way so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sorn is 40 years old and married with four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. For the past 5 years Sorn has been earning a living through farming on a seven-hectare plot of farmland. Her husband is a fisherman; together they can earn about KHR 24,000 per day from the current businesses and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. Insufficient working capital to buy fertilizers for her rice field is her main challenge. 

This is the first loan for Sorn’s group of two members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each, Sorn wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from the rice paddy so as to sell it for a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Battambng province’s Moung Russey district, Srey is 39 years old and married with five dependent children, some are in school and some are too young for school. For the last 10 years, Srey has been farming rice on 7 hectares of farmland to support her family. With the current business, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Srey has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already, while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Srey completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for another loan. Srey, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow rice fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
A villager from the Kam Rieng district in the Battambang province, Nga is 24 years old and married. She has two dependent children who are still small. The main source of her family’s income is from farming on one hectare of farmland. 

Having been in this business for five years, Nga is able to earn a daily income of KHR 40,000 to support her family. She is able to save about KHR 20,000 per day for her future needs. Her main business challenge is a low crop yield.  

This is the first loan for Nga with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She will also use a portion of the loan to pay her labor costs. 

Nga hopes to increase her crop yield so as to fulfill her dreams of buying a plot of farmland and earning a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun, age 36, is a diligent farmer who lives with his spouse in a village in the Phnom Proek district of the province of Battambang. He has no children. 

To support his family, Sokun has been farming rice and also planting corn, beans and cassava. Having been in this business for 10 years, he is able to earn about KHR 80,000 per day. He manages to save about KHR 20,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. His main business challenge is a lack of working capital to support his business.

Sokun is the first cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is requesting a loan of KHR 650,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. Through this loan, Sokun hopes to earn a high yield from his plantation and increase his income so he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is 38 years old and a married mother who has been blessed with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She resides in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To support the family, Sreymom has been selling cakes, while her husband helps to earn extra income for the family by working for others for a fee. Engaged in this business for 5 years, Sreymom and her husband can earn approximately 32,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Sreymom’s group consists of four members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy cakes for resale. Sreymom hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cakes for resale

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat, 42, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and they are in school. Rice farming and sugarcane planting on 2 hectares of farmland are the main sources of her family’s income, which Phat has been in for 10 years. To add up more income for the family, her husband also raises pigs in the local area. The current business earns her approximately 19,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Phat has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles and completely paid back the past loan, which has improved her family's livelihood. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. Phat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. Phat hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice fruitfully and timely so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is a 42-year-old married woman who has been farming rice on three hectares and planting cassava on five hectares of land as the main sources of family income for 22 years. She lives in a wooden house in a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her daily income is approximately 30,000 KHRy, and she manages to save about 18,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. The main challenge for her paddy field is drought.

Pheap’ group consists of four members who live in the same village. This is the group's first loan with VisionFund, and as the leader, Pheap will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and pay the cost of plowing the field. Through this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her plantation so as to better her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Cheang's Group

texts.en:
Cheang is 62 years old and widowed. She has six children. To feed the family, she has been farming rice 30 years and supplementing their family’s income by planting cassava to better support the family. The current business earns her about 16,000 KHR per day and manages her to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low price of cassava is the main challenge for her. 

Cheang’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is a first-cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Cheang, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her plantation. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Kimhim's Group

texts.en:
Kimhim, age 48, resides in a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children; one of her children is dependent and still in school. To make a living, Kimhim has been engaged in rice farming and cassava planting for 20 years. The current business earns her approximately 18,000 KHR per day for the family needs. Low price of her crop yield is the main challenge.

Kimhim’s group is composed of four members who live in the same village. She is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Kimhim is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and timely so as to make their living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is a 37-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. All of her children are dependents; one is in school while the remaining one is too young for school. Besides rice farming, Ra’s husband also complements the income by working as a taxi driver. Having been in this occupation for 10 years, they are able to earn about 70,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital to support the paddy-field is still the main challenge. 

Ra has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and fully paid back the past loans. She has wisely used the previous loans to better support her family with enough foods. She is asking for another loan with VisionFund of 1,500,000 KHR. Ra is going to utilize her loan to buy rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 55 years old and a married father of seven children, one of whom is still dependent and in school. He lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. The main income of the family is from farming and planting oranges. His wife also raises pigs to earn additional income. Having been involved in this business for 8 years, Ann and his wife are able to earn about 33,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield in the rice farming business, resulting from insufficient water supply, is still the main challenge. 

Ann has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans, which he fully paid back, have supported his current business. Now he is applying for another loan of 1,500,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizer for his cultivated land. Ann hopes this loan will help him to grow his rice successfully so as to improve hygienic living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cultivated land

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A villager residing in a rural area of Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Sarom is 35 years old and married. To make a living, she has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland. Her husband works as a teacher in the local area to earn more income for the family. Sarom has six years of experience in her current business, earning approximately 16,000 KHR per day and managing to save around 10,000 KHR for future needs. Insufficient water supply is the main challenge for her faming business. 

Sarom’s group consists of five members who live in the same village, and this is the fifth microloan for her with VisionFund. The past loans, which she fully paid back, have relieved her family burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her some of her money to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and use a portion of it for labor costs. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy fields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Sokun is a 27-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on a 5-hectare plot of farmland, while her husband supplements the income by catching fish. They have been in this business for six years. With the current business, Sokun can earn about KHR 28,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. Lack of working capital to support the business is the main challenge for her.

This is the fifth loan for Sokun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully paid back the loans, which have helped her to improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
Sovann, 36, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Kampong Cham and he is married with three children, who are all still in school. The family’s main sources of income are from farming rice on 7 hectares of farmland and catching fishes in the local village. Sovann has been in this business for several years. The current business earns him approximately 27,000 KHR per day. He can save about 10,000 KHR each day after off-setting daily expenses.

Sovann is in his first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now he is leading his group of three to ask for a loan. Sovann wants to utilize his portion to buy a boat for his fishing business and use a portion of it to buy fishing materials such as cast nets, etc.. He hopes this loan will enable him to catch more fishes so as to sell them for a good price to improve his living condition.

loans.use: To buy a boat for his fishing business

loans.name: Montha

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Kandal Stoeng district of Cambodia, Montha is 48 years old and widowed. She is a mother of one son, who is still in school. She has struggled to feed to her family through farming rice. To gain more income to better support the family, Montha also sells snacks in the local area. She has been in this business for 20 years and she is able to earn from the current business 12 USD and manages to save about 4 USD each day after deducting daily expenses.

Montha has been a member of VisionFund for 5 cycles already and successfully paid back the past loans. The loans from VisionFund have helped her relieve the family’s living condition. Now requesting a loan of 700 USD, she will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. Montha hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sokhern

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Sokhern is a 50-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. 

Buying and selling garbage has been the only source for her family’s income for two years. The main challenge for her family’s business is the lack of working capital to support the business.

This is Sokhern’s first loan with VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan of US $1,000. With this loan, she is going to buy garbage for resale. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy garbage (recyclables) for resale.

loans.name: Sokhan's Group

texts.en:
Aged 49 years old, Sokhan is a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district. She earns a living through farming rice as her only main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for twenty-one years. She has three children who are still dependent and in school. 

Her family’s daily income is about 70,000 KHR per day, but she manages to save about 20,000 KHR after daily expenses. Insufficient capital to buy fertilizer for applying to her farmland is the main challenge for her business. 

Sokhan’s group consists of two members who are both female. She is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her to better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each, Sokhan will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Malis' Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Malis is 36 years old and married. She and her husband have one son who is still in school. She earns a living through farming and she has been in this business for several years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 32,000 KHR per day to support her family.  A lack of working capital is the main challenge for her farming business. 

This is the first loan for Malis with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she is leading a group of two borrowers. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to get higher crop yields and sell them for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kimheng's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village in the Ratanak Mondul district, Kimheng is a 25-year-old mother of one daughter who is too young for school. The main source of family’s income is from corn planting on 1 hectare of farmland, a business Kimheng has been in for five years. She currently earns about KHR 50,000 per day and can save about KHR 8,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Kimheng with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is leading a group of six members, and will use her portion of the loan to buy pesticides for her farmland. Kimheng hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Choam's Group

texts.en:
Choam, 33, is from a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He is married and has three children, all of whom are dependents and too young for school. He and his wife earn a living by farming, on three hectares of farmland. They have been in this business for ten years. The current business earns his family about 42,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day, after covering daily living expenses. 

This is Choam’s group's microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and he is a fourth-time borrower, while the other members are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now he is leading his group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Choam is going to use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to increase his family’s income, so as to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district, is 26 years old and single. To make a living, she has been providing tailoring services. Having been in this business for five years, she currently can earn about 90,000 KHR per day, and can manage to save about 40,000 each day after offsetting daily living expenses. 

This is the microloan for Thy’s group of two.  She is a client in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. Thy hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income and to provide them a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Rith's Group

texts.en:
Rith is from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district, where rice farming is a common way to earn a living. She is aged 40 years and married. She has four children, who are dependents and still in school. She and her husband have struggled to feed the family by farming rice, and selling grocery items in the village. Having been in business for 21 years, their current businesses earn her family approximately 21,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Rith is a third-time borrower with VisionFund, and she has fully paid back the past loans. She is now leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds for her farmland, and to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income, so as to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland, and to buy more grocery items to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lem's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Bakan district, Lem is 30 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependents and help the family business. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on five hectares, which she and her husband have been doing for 8 years to make a living. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Lem’s group consists of seven members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Lem, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor lives in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district located in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a 48-year-old married woman with two children, one (son) of whom is under her responsibility. Sor has been involved in a rice-growing business for more than twenty years. To earn extra income for the family, Sor's husband plants cassava on three hectares of farmland. Sor has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for one loan cycle and has already succeeded in making her family's livelihood much better.

Sor is the leader of this 2-member loan group; she and the other member, Tona, want to take out loans of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR respectively. Sor will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer to support her rice-growing business and her husband’s cassava-planting business. She is very satisfied that her family's lifestyle will improve gradually with the help of the requested loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chhen's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of four children, Chhen is age 58, living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has one dependent child to take care of and is still in school. To support her family, Chhen and her husband farm rice and work for others for a fee as the main source of their family’s income and they have been in this business for 30 years. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 7,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Chhen’s group is composed of three members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chhen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a bike for her child to commute to school. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy-field so as to sell it for a good price to improve her living condition and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Magdalena de 36 años tienen tres hijos todos estudian, habita en la colonia El Verdum desde niña ha ido adquiriendo conocimientos en la actividad agrícola, cultura heredada por sus padres, ahora es dueña de su propia parcela en donde trabaja con su esposo, actualmente tiene 2 mzs de yuca en la cual posee experiencia en el manejo técnico del cultivo y para darle mantenimiento solicita a Afodenic apoyo de crédito para brindarle un buen cuido y evitar las plagas, para así obtener buenos rendimientos productivos ya que es una excelente comercialización a un buen precio, y con los ingresos ayudara a preparar a sus hijos en el colegio y a su familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 36 years old and has three children in school. She lives in the El Verdum district and since she was little she has acquired knowledge of agriculture a business she inherited from her parents. She now owns her own plot of land where she works with her husband. She currently has two manzanas [3.44 acres] of yuca. She has the experience in technical management and maintenance of the crop. 

She is asking Afodenic for a loan to care for and prevent pests in order to get good productive yields since it sells for a good price. With the profits she will help her family and prepare her children for school.

loans.use: To purchase the components to plant and  maintain yuca

loans.name: Chomreoun

texts.en:
Chomreoun is a resident of a rural village in the Sampov Meas district located in Pursat province, Cambodia. She is 44 years of age, divorced and the single mother of a son who is still under her responsibility and currently in school. To provide a decent life for her family, this industrious mother works so many jobs. Chomreoun raises pigs and chickens and also works for others in order to earn extra income for her family. She is able to earn approximately 11,000 KHR daily, of which she saves around 5,000 KHR after offsetting her expenses.

This is Chomreoun's first loan via Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She plans to use a portion of this KHR 1,000,000 loan to buy more pigs and chickens to raise and to buy feed for the animals. The other portion of the loan will be spent on buying studying materials and a bicycle for her only son. Chomreoun's only hope is to be able to educate her child so that he will have a bright future and become a potential youth in society.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and chickens to raise

loans.name: Leke

texts.en:
Leke is a 63-year-old mother of two (who are aged 24 and 20 years old). She lives with them and her husband in a very rural village in south-central Albania. 

For 20 years, Leke has been farming on her farmland, planting crops for animal feed, potatoes, grains and vegetables. She then sells the produce to a wide clientele -- sometimes to store owners, other times to wholesale buyers, and still other times to individual customers that she finds in the local market of a town near her home. This business has proved to be profitable, and she has engaged her children in the activity as well, since they don’t go to school. 

Leke is requesting a loan of 100,000 ALL (Albanian Lek) from Kiva, and wants to use it to buy inputs for seasonal farming.

loans.use: To plant crops for seasonal farming.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en: Malek is a 22-year-old, single man, who has one family member, from Baqa'a Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay tuition for his college studies. He wants to continue his education. He hopes in the future to benefit from another loan to improve his socio-economic status. Because Malek is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his college studies.

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en:
Rim, aged 44, lives in Pursat province's Bakan district in Cambodia. She is married and has six children, three of whom (sons) are school-aged children and dependent on her. Rim and her husband earn their living by working as rice farmers on two hectares of farmland. They are able to earn around 13,000 KHR per day.

Rim's group consists of two female members, both first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Rim is leading her group to take out a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR. Rim will use her portion, 1,000,000 KHR, to purchase fertilizer to support her family's rice-growing business. She hopes that this loan will help to provide good quality crop yields so that she can boost her income and use it to improve her family's lifestyle and, most importantly, to educate her children by sending them to a good school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man who has two family members and lives in Baqa'a, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD in order to allow him to pay for his home improvements. Specifically, Ahmad would like to buy new furniture for, as well as repaint, his home. He hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a new home and continue to support his children through their education.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari is a 55-year-old married woman from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. She has four family members.

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to do maintenance of the home and repaint it. 

She hopes in the future to do other maintenance to the home and to buy new furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Linaa

texts.en: Linaa is a 28-year-old married woman from Baqa'a Jordan who has 1 family member. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to buy a new refrigerator. In the past she was selling blankets and still does to improve her living standard. In the future she hopes to buy a new home and car. She also hopes to continue her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 40-year-old married woman who has two family members and lives in AL Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to allow her to purchase women's and children's clothing for resale. Once purchased, Ferial then intends on selling the clothing to her friends and neighbors, who live in the same area as she does. She wants to use the proceeds from the loan to increase her inventory. In the future, Ferial hopes to buy additional products for resale and eventually open a shop. 

Due to cultural reasons, Ferial prefers that her photograph is not posted online. Therefore, the photograph posted in relation to this loan is of her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to allow her to pay for her home improvements. Specifically, Abeer would like to undertake general home maintenance as well as repaint her home. In the future, she hopes to be able to provide a good living environment for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ram

texts.en: Ram is a 58-year-old widow residing in a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng district located in Kandal province, Cambodia. She has three children, all of whom are employed. To support her family, Ram has been working as a rice farmer for twenty years. This will be her third loan request via VisionFund, Kiva's partner. Ram's previous loans, which she has already repaid, have helped her to better meet her family's needs and to improve their living conditions. She is now requesting an 800 USD loan in order to purchase a motorbike to facilitate her children's commuting between home and their workplace. The hope of this industrious single mother, Ram, is to be able to support her children's commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Khaledieh in Jordan. She has three dependents and requested a 500 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for retailing clothes. In the future, Eman is planning to make some improvements to her home and renew furniture in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for retailing clothes

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 24-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan who has 1 family member. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy women's and children's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She would like to increase the products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop. 

Since Rasha is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 38-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Jordan. She has 3 children. Hala has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes and cosmetics, which she plans to sell to her neighbors and relatives. in the future, Hala plans to open her own shop and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Ibdour

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Ibdour prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son. Ibdour is a 40-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan, who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements such as repainting and home  maintenance. Ibdour hopes, in the future, to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Jawaher

texts.en: Jawaher is a 50-year-old married woman from Jubeiha, Amman, Jordan who has 6 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en: Rahmeh is a 34-year-old divorced female from Al Khaledieh in Jordan. She requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for cosmetics and perfumes to sell. In the future, Rahmeh is planning to have her own shop, to increase income and improve her family's living conditions and renew their furniture.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Islam prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Islam is a 26-year-old married woman  from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements; she would like to buy a new television and a new oven. She hopes, in the future, to benefit from another loan to do home maintenance.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Andalib

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Andalib prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Andalib is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements; she would like to buy new furniture for the home. In the past, Andalib sold clothes and blankets to increase her income. She hopes, in the future, to benefit from another loan to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en: Fadwa is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy materials for sewing, such as a sewing machine, fabric, silk and beads to make clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors. Fadwa hopes, in the future, to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Sana'a prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Sana'a is a 27-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan, who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements such as repainting and decorating. In the future, she hopes to do maintenance on the home to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Ghada prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Ghada is a 22-year-old, married woman, from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has two children. She requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for a refrigerator for her home, and some home improvement and painting expenses. 

In the future, she is planning to build an additional room.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator for her home, and some home improvements

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a home-based variety store and carinderia (food kiosk). She has had this kind of business for 24 years, and earns about PHP 7,000 a month. She uses her income to pay for her family’s household expenditures, daily allowances and school fees of her youngest child. She wants to have more stock of groceries such as canned goods,assorted biscuits,soft drinks and some detergent soap to sell within her local community. With her determination to improve her variety store,she is seeking for additional working capital in the amount of PHP 20,000. She hopes to make her business more productive so that her expectations and dreams will be fulfilled someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries such as canned goods,assorted biscuits,soft drinks and some detergent soap for her retail store

loans.name: Carlyn

texts.en: Carlyn is 22 years of age, married, and has one child. She sells a variety of frozen foods, and has been in this type of business for three years now. Her main goal is to increase the amount of frozen foods she offers, but does not have enough money, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more frozen foods to sell. She knows that with this loan she could improve her financial stability and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Ruba prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Ruba is a 34-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and repaint her home. Also she wants to do maintenance of the home. In the future she hopes to expand her home and to buy other furniture by benefiting from another loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is a 36-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan, who has 2 family members. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JOD to buy foodstuffs to resell in his grocery store. Murad wants to increase his products. In the future, he hopes to expand his project by opening a shop.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en: Radwan is a 56-year-old married man from Bani Kenanah, Jordan. He has 6 children. Radwan has requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for opening a grocery store selling cleaning supplies, grocery items, and candies. in the future, Radwan plans to expand his project, adding shelves to the store, painting it and expanding the variety of items offered, in order to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for opening a small grocery store

loans.name: Ayedah

texts.en: Ayedah is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan, who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for home improvements; she would like to buy new furniture and to do home maintenance. Ayedah hopes, in the future, to buy more furniture and to do maintenance in the kitchen to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 34 years old and married, from Marka in Jordan. She has seven children.

She has requested a JOD 600 loan to pay for her making some improvements to her kitchen floor. in the future, Raeda is planning to do further improvements, buy some furnature, and buy a car.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en: For cultural reasons, Sultanah prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Sultanah is a 33-year-old married woman  from Jarsah, Jordan who has 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for the home improvements that she would like to do, including maintaining her kitchen and buying new kitchen cabinets.
